tasks.task: Preparing and fertilizing soil for plants.
subtasks: Stirring the liquid fertilizer solution.
Applying the liquid fertilizer solution to the soil.
Ensuring even coverage of the solution on the soil surface.
Watering the plants to help distribute the fertilizer evenly.
Monitoring for issues like fungus gnats that may arise from improper soil treatment.

tasks.task: Maintaining plant health and hygiene.
subtasks: Checking for signs of fungus gnats around the plants.
Taking preventive measures if fungus gnats are present.

tasks.task: Ensuring proper soil moisture.
subtasks: Watering the plants as needed to keep the soil moist.
Not overwatering to prevent excess moisture which could lead to fungus growth.

tasks.task: Prepare the liquid fertilizer solution.
subtasks: Measure the necessary amount of fertilizer.
Pour the fertilizer into a container.
Add water to the container and mix thoroughly, stirring.

tasks.task: Apply the liquid fertilizer solution to the soil.
subtasks: Pour the mixed solution onto the soil surface.
Use a watering can or sprayer to apply the solution evenly.

tasks.task: Ensure even coverage of the solution on the soil.
subtasks: Walk back and forth over the planting area, ensuring the solution spreads out properly.

tasks.task: Water the plants for the first time to help distribute the fertilizer evenly.
subtasks: Use a watering can or sprinkler system to water the plants.
Adjust the watering to ensure the liquid fertilizer is distributed throughout the soil.

tasks.task: Monitor the plants for signs of fungus gnats.
subtasks: Regularly inspect the soil surface and around the plants for small flying insects.
If fungus gnats are present, take preventive measures such as increasing ventilation, covering the soil with a barrier, or applying insecticides.

tasks.task: Ensure proper soil moisture levels.
subtasks: Check the soil moisture by inserting a finger or using a moisture meter.
Water the plants as needed, but avoid overwatering to prevent fungal growth.
Dilute the concentrated fertilizer according to the package instructions.

tasks.task: Prepare the liquid fertilizer solution before applying to the soil.
Apply the liquid fertilizer solution to the soil.
Spread the liquid fertilizer solution evenly over the soil surface.
Water the plants for the first time, which will enhance the distribution of the fertilizer.
Monitor the plants for signs of fungus gnats.
Address any fungus gnat issues by improving conditions.
Manage soil moisture levels to prevent fungal growth.
### MAINTASKs and Subtasks
Prepare the liquid fertilizer solution by measuring and diluting the concentrate.
subtasks: Dilute concentrate with water.
Measure required concentrate.
Pour concentrate into a container.
Add water and stir thoroughly.

tasks.task: Apply the solution evenly to the soil.
subtasks: Pour using a watering can or sprayer.

tasks.task: Ensure even coverage.
subtasks: Walk in crisscross pattern.

tasks.task: Water plants immediately afterward to distribute fertilizer.
subtasks: Use proper watering technique to penetrate soil.

tasks.task: Monitor for fungus gnats.
subtasks: Inspect soil and plants for infestation signs.

tasks.task: Address pest issues.
subtasks: Improve air circulation, remove affected parts, apply barriers.

tasks.task: Maintain soil moisture.
subtasks: Check moisture levels, avoid overwatering.
